reviews.comment: The media could not be loaded.I'm 65, 5'5" (shrinking), 191 (increasing), XL (because I like clothes to be roomy).  I ordered this in a L because some of the reviews seem to indicate that the dress fit large.  I'm here to say I don't agree.  This fit true to size.  A large fits me as a large should and that's why I don't particularly care for it and will send it back for an XL.  I feel it is a bit too fitted in the belly (fat) area and behind as well as at the shoulder and under the arms.  If I feel it, I don't like it.  The material is soft and light, pockets on either hip are deep but without sticking out on the hip, and the pattern is a soft green and pink with white.  The pattern is unique from all the 10 same faabric choices coming out of China right now.  The hem has a flirty little spin to it when twisting the hips and the V neckline is not deep or exposing of the cleavage.  The length is just above the knee, a nice modest length so as not to rise too high when seated.  All in all it is a great summer dress for most jobs, the beach, restaurants, shows, etc.  I do think if the sun is shining behind it undergarments will be outlined so I would put the visibility factor at around 4 out of 10.  Somewhat modest but maybe a camisole or half slip if you really want to be completely covered.  In fluorescent light I believe there would be no concern of visibility.  The price is right and the design options are varied.Read more

reviews.comment: Let me start by saying this dress didn’t just arrive—it ascended into my life, wrapped in tissue paper like a pastel prophecy. From the moment I put it on, I knew it was special. Not only did it fit like it was tailored by woodland fairies who specialize in waist-cinching magic, but it also made me look like I had an actual figure instead of my usual "vaguely human-shaped laundry pile" aesthetic.The waist? Perfection. It nips in just enough to make me look like I have an hourglass silhouette instead of a "slightly squashed rectangle." The skirt? Absolute twirl supremacy. I spun around like a deranged ballerina in my living room, and not once did I fear a wardrobe malfunction—this dress is modest but in a "I’m classy, not frumpy" kind of way. No accidental sheerness, no awkward shortness, just pure, unadulterated twirlability.I wore it for Easter, and let me tell you, I didn’t just attend brunch—I floated into that room like a pink cloud of elegance. My relatives, who usually greet me with "Oh, you look... tired," actually said, "Wow, you look nice!" (A Christmas miracle in April.) Even after three helpings of ham and approximately seven deviled eggs, the dress still fit like a dream. No unbuttoning in the bathroom, no desperate stretch-and-sigh. Just pure, uninterrupted comfort.If you’re looking for a dress that makes you feel feminine, put-together, and secretly like the protagonist of a rom-com where you accidentally fall in love with a baker during a spring festival—this is the one. Five stars, zero regrets, and 100% chance I’ll be wearing this to every vaguely spring occasion until I die.Read more
